text: real life goodfellas cash as protest and
the overachieving Mars rover good
evening this is the New York Times
minute Cardinal journal at Kennedy
Airport the infamous 1978 Lufthansa
heist netted 5 million dollars in cash
and even made it into Goodfellas but
most of the real-life perpetrators were
never caught today that changed with the
arrest of Vincent asaro accused of
participating in that robbery along with
a myriad of other crimes in Thailand the
government froze protest leader su tight
tuck subin's accounts now his supporters
give him Garland's of cash Tom fuller
reports from Bangkok it's slightly
jarring to witness the leader of a
protest movement that has declared a war
on corruption collecting cash by the
bagful and NASA marks the 10th
anniversary of the Mars rover
Opportunity built for a three-month
mission it's still returning data today
with a 14 million dollar annual cost the
question is how much longer can it go as
long as the rover keeps going looking
